*Background of The Request:*

Currently Confluence does not have the ability to exclude any blogposts when user want to export a space into XML while user able to exclude any pages from the custom XML export creation.

h5. Steps to reproduce:
# Access Confluence in IE browser
# Create a Confluence page
# Insert [Page Layout|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Working+with+Page+Layouts+and+Columns+and+Sections] e.g. Three columns
# Add text to all elements, add some links to that text.
# Save the page
# Edit the page. Editing of the links on top will work ok. 
# Scroll down. Editing of links is no longer possible, the menu (Go to link, Edit and Unlink) are not displayed. The layout flickers when links are clicked.
# See the screen cast for details: http://screencast.com/t/Y42hyAaiPFo
# Same issue is not observed without the use of [Page Layout|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Working+with+Page+Layouts+and+Columns+and+Sections] in IE
# Here's a sample space xml backup from a freshly installed Confluence 5.0.2 that represents the problem: [^ds-152558-6.xml.zip] - sample taken from Demonstration Space

h5. Workaround:
# Edit the links using [Confluence Source Editor|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.editor.confluence-source-editor] in IE browser
# Use Chrome or Firefox browser instead

h5. Note:
Upon further research, I found out that the issue only occurred when you have to scroll down the page to edit the links. It seems that when the page layout height is more than the default editor height (the need to scroll down the page), problem exist.

h5. Root Cause
The underlying problem is that Internet Explorer fires a scrolling event sometimes when the link is clicked, which results in the property panel being closed (which when scrolling normally is what is expected).
fields.summary: Link in Confluence pages cannot be edited in IE9, IE10 & IE11 when Page Layout is in used

  {panel}

Plugins that poll continuously for data (like quick reload or mywork) sometimes create to much load on servers having impact on OnDemand or even causing issues in CAC. This should be review and improved. Some suggestions and things that have been talked about:
* Review min time for polling. Do we really need to ask for stuff every 20 seconds?
* Make sure we only poll when it makes sense: user/tab active, logged in users vs anonymous users, page new or active vs old pages that are not modified...
* Back off polling more aggressively according to response time or stop polling if error response received (this would avoid overloading slow servers even more)
* Ideally we would have a single polling thread (or even websocket) that can be shared between plugins
fields.summary: Reduce traffic/load generated by polling plugins

*BUG FIX: While Creating links in IE8, it drops to another line.*

We think that the problem is due to the IF_ELSE IF css conditional comments used in the code to detect different browsers. From our previous coding experience we have found IF_ELSE IF css conditional statement is not a good way to detect browsers and control their individual browser behaviour. Its creating major issues intermittently on IE browsers, but it didn't happen on other browsers.

We will suggest to use different script eg php/javascript etc to detect browsers and assign with individual css for each type, version of browsers and OS platforms if required. That is the safest way to do from our coding experiences. It may solve most of the IE compatability mode issue.

I am opening this issue for voting so that it can be fixed soon.

Thanks

The configuration on server.conf is really tedious. Every time I upgrade my system I take 25 minutes instead of 2, this is because I have to stop the confluence instance again after upgrade and redo every custom configuration.
The most annoying thing a have to do (so annoying that I keep my instance out of date and wait some updates until the upgrade worthwhile) is:
1. Stop confluence. Again (this take time on my system)
2. Move (don't copy) activation-1.0.2.jar and mail-1.4.1.jar from <confluence-install>/confluence/WEB-INF/lib to <confluence-install>/lib.
(Are you seriously? Why a have to do that? And why the confluence package don't do that by default? Some freak bug like some microsoft products? Just kidding )
3. I'm smart so I don't type again the configuration on server.xml, I make a copy, but I cannot ensure that my copy just change the lines for mail config and  I have to make a diff on the command line to be sure that I will not break the system and have to stop confluence again.

Not least but important too. I have to take care of the security of that file, if someone read that content my account is compromised. Well my system is secured and only root has access but who knows, and what about shared servers that others can be using, like universities?

Jira have a configuration for SMTP SSL email, and this is not broken between upgrades because is in the database.


This is easy to implement in spring config. So be nice with me and other sys devs. :-) 

By the way, I have other configurations like SSO with Crowd. Is tedius too, every config that depends on files and cannot be automatic created by confluence (and jira, and stash, and crowd) is tedius to maintain between upgrades. 

Keep all on database and make the upgrade a easy, funny and routine part of your products :P

h2. Fixed in 5.1.3
We've put a fix for the Chrome bug in Confluence 5.1.3, upgrading to this release will fix the problem. Confluence OnDemand already has this fix and is not impacted. 

For people who can't immediately upgrade, there is a CSS workaround you can apply. We will shortly be releasing a plugin to do this automatically for you.

h2. Fixed via Plugin

The [Editor Height Fix for Confluence Plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.editor-height-fix] automatically adds the CSS mentioned in the workaround below.

You can install it directly through the product (search for Editor Height Fix). 

NB: You may need to set your [Page Layout|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Customising+Site+and+Space+Layouts] back to default if you are still experiencing the issue after performing these steps.

h2. Workaround if plugin cannot be installed.
You can apply some custom CSS to resolve the issue. 

NB: You may need to set your [Page Layout|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Customising+Site+and+Space+Layouts] back to default if you are still experiencing the issue after performing these steps.

h4. Steps for Confluence 4.x

h6. Global Stylesheet
This will fix the bug in all Spaces using the default theme:
* Click 'Browse' in the header and click 'Confluence Admin'
* Click 'Stylesheet' under 'Look and Feel'
* Click the 'Edit' button on the 'Global Stylesheet' screen
* Paste the CSS snippet from below and click the 'Save' button

h6. Space Stylesheet
For spaces using the Documentation, Easy reader, or a custom theme, you need to apply the CSS change to them individually:
* Navigate to the space
* Click 'Browse' in the header and click 'Space Admin'
* Click 'Stylesheet' under 'Look and Feel'
* Click the 'Edit' button
* Paste the CSS snippet from below and click the 'Save' button

h4. Steps for Confluence 5.x

h6. Global Stylesheet
This will fix the bug in all Spaces using the default theme:
* Click the 'Cog' in the header and click 'Confluence Admin'
* Click 'Stylesheet' under 'Look and Feel'
* Click the 'Edit' button on the 'Global Stylesheet' screen
* Paste the CSS snippet from below and click the 'Save' button

h6. Space Stylesheet
For spaces using the Documentation, Easy reader, or a custom theme, you need to apply the CSS change to them individually:
* Navigate to the space
* Click 'Browse' in the header and click 'Space Admin'
* Click 'Stylesheet' under 'Look and Feel'
* Click the 'Edit' button
* Paste the CSS snippet from below and click the 'Save' button

h4. CSS snippet
{code}
/* CONF-28415 */
form.editor .editor-default,
.editor-fullheight {
    height: 100%;
    height: auto\9; /* IE8 */
}
{code}

fields.description:
The ImagePlaceHolders use GETs to send macro parameters to the server.  This works well most of the time but causes problems when a macro's parameters exceed the query limit for a GET request.  This is usually 2k.  During an editing session, often the client side and server side are out of sync, as there is usually a delay between making a save and the draft saving.

This all works ok if your macro place holder is a static image.  If you want the macro place holder to reflect the current editing state then you need to communicate this change to the server during the edit.  One option is to trigger a draft save and leave it up to the macro place holder code to find the right version of the draft and do its work.

A better solution would be for the editor to POST after a macro has been edited so the parameters can be sent to the server and stored in some temporary location like the session.  The image place holder logic can then check the session for the up to date parameters and pass on to the macro with no change (instead of passing them through from the GET).  This would replace the need to pass the macro parameters to the image URL as parameters.

The GET mechanism with macro parameters would still need to work and could be the default behaviour if the query string is short, or the GET vs POST options could be controlled by configuration.

This problem also comes up when using plugins 3 macros.
fields.summary: ImagePlaceHolders don't work when macro parameters reach a certain size

The creator column in the CONTENT_PERM should not be null unless the user that caused that record to be added was really anonymous.

For reference see:
https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-95615
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/133543/space-admin-page-restrictions-creator-shows-as-anonymous-when-it-isn-t-bug

To confirm, Adrien Ragot (Atlassian) in answers confirmed it was a bug:

"I have just noticed a small bug: When you use the Restrictions dialog to add several groups, the first group always appears in CONTENT_PERM with CREATOR = NULL and all the other groups have a value in CREATOR."

Bruna Griebeler (Atlassian) also mentioned was a bug when she said in the support ticket:

"As we talked yesterday, this is the query to set the creator as the lastmodifier user, to avoid let the creator as null, for security reasons.

update CONTENT_PERM set CREATOR=LASTMODIFIER where creator=NULL;

PS: Please create a backup of your database before running that query!!
About the bug itself, I'll talk with a developer and will let you know as soon as possible."

In the support ticket, the customer indicated that they would like to see a resolution that does not involve having to run a SQL update frequently.

Without a customer workaround, this bug basically disables the ability for the space administrator to audit changes properly.
